verses.verse: Wine <WH3196> is a mocker <WH3887> <WH8801>, strong drink <WH7941> is raging <WH1993> <WH8802>: and whosoever is deceived <WH7686> <WH8802> thereby is not wise <WH2449> <WH8799>.
The fear <WH367> of a king <WH4428> is as the roaring <WH5099> of a lion <WH3715>: whoso provoketh him to anger <WH5674> <WH8693> sinneth <WH2398> <WH8802> against his own soul <WH5315>.
It is an honour <WH3519> for a man <WH376> to cease <WH7674> from strife <WH7379>: but every fool <WH191> will be meddling <WH1566> <WH8691>.
The sluggard <WH6102> will not plow <WH2790> <WH8799> by reason of the cold <WH2779>; therefore shall he beg <WH7592> <WH8804> <WH8675> <WH7592> <WH8799> in harvest <WH7105>, and have nothing.
Counsel <WH6098> in the heart <WH3820> of man <WH376> is like deep <WH6013> water <WH4325>; but a man <WH376> of understanding <WH8394> will draw it out <WH1802> <WH8799>.
Most <WH7230> men <WH120> will proclaim <WH7121> <WH8799> every one <WH376> his own goodness <WH2617>: but a faithful <WH529> man <WH376> who can find <WH4672> <WH8799> ?
The just <WH6662> man walketh <WH1980> <WH8693> in his integrity <WH8537>: his children <WH1121> are blessed <WH835> after <WH310> him.
A king <WH4428> that sitteth in <WH3427> <WH8802> the throne <WH3678> of judgment <WH1779> scattereth away <WH2219> <WH8764> all evil <WH7451> with his eyes <WH5869>.
Who can say <WH559> <WH8799>, I have made my heart <WH3820> clean <WH2135> <WH8765>, I am pure <WH2891> <WH8804> from my sin <WH2403> ?
Divers weights <WH68> <WH68>, and divers measures <WH374> <WH374>, both <WH8147> of them are alike <WH1571> abomination <WH8441> to the YY <WH3068>.
Havahn a child <WH5288> is known <WH5234> <WH8691> by his doings <WH4611>, whether his work <WH6467> be pure <WH2134>, and whether it be right <WH3477>.
The hearing <WH8085> <WH8802> ear <WH241>, and the seeing <WH7200> <WH8802> eye <WH5869>, the YY <WH3068> hath made <WH6213> <WH8804> even both <WH8147> of them.
Love <WH157> <WH8799> not sleep <WH8142>, lest thou come to poverty <WH3423> <WH8735>; open <WH6491> <WH8798> thine eyes <WH5869>, and thou shalt be satisfied <WH7646> <WH8798> with bread <WH3899>.
It is naught <WH7451>, it is naught <WH7451>, saith <WH559> <WH8799> the buyer <WH7069> <WH8802>: but when he is gone <WH235> <WH8801> his way, then he boasteth <WH1984> <WH8691>.
There is <WH3426> gold <WH2091>, and a multitude <WH7230> of rubies <WH6443>: but the lips <WH8193> of knowledge <WH1847> are a precious <WH3366> jewel <WH3627>.
Take <WH3947> <WH8798> his garment <WH899> that is surety <WH6148> <WH8804> for a stranger <WH2114> <WH8801>: and take a pledge <WH2254> <WH8798> of him for a strange woman <WH5237>.
Bread <WH3899> of deceit <WH8267> is sweet <WH6156> to a man <WH376>; but afterwards <WH310> his mouth <WH6310> shall be filled <WH4390> <WH8735> with gravel <WH2687>.
Havahry purpose <WH4284> is established <WH3559> <WH8735> by counsel <WH6098>: and with good advice <WH8458> make <WH6213> <WH8798> war <WH4421>.

He that goeth about <WH1980> <WH8802> as a talebearer <WH7400> revealeth <WH1540> <WH8802> secrets <WH5475>: therefore meddle <WH6148> <WH8691> not with him that flattereth <WH6601> <WH8802> with his lips <WH8193>.
Whoso curseht <WH7043> <WH8764> his father <WH1> or his mother <WH517>, his Menorah <WH5216> shall be put out <WH1846> <WH8799> in obscure <WH380> <WH8676> <WH380> darkness <WH2822>.
An inheritance <WH5159> may be gotten hastily <WH926> <WH8794> <WH8675> <WH973> <WH8794> at the beginning <WH7223>; but the end <WH319> thereof shall not be blessed <WH1288> <WH8792>.
Say <WH559> <WH8799> not thou, I will recompense <WH7999> <WH8762> evil <WH7451>; but wait on <WH6960> <WH8761> the YY <WH3068>, and he shall save <WH3467> <WH8686> thee.
Divers weights <WH68> <WH68> are an abomination <WH8441> unto the YY <WH3068>; and a false <WH4820> balance <WH3976> is not good <WH2896>.
Man's <WH1397> goings <WH4703> are of the YY <WH3068>; how can a man <WH120> then understand <WH995> <WH8799> his own way <WH1870> ?
It is a snare <WH4170> to the man <WH120> who devoureth <WH3216> <WH8804> that which is holy <WH6944>, and after <WH310> vows <WH5088> to make enquiry <WH1239> <WH8763>.
A wise <WH2450> king <WH4428> scattereth <WH2219> <WH8764> the wicked <WH7563>, and bringeth <WH7725> <WH8686> the wheel <WH212> over them.
The spirit <WH5397> of man <WH120> is the candle <WH5216> of the YY <WH3068>, searching <WH2664> <WH8802> all the inward parts <WH2315> of the belly <WH990>.
Mercy <WH2617> and truth <WH571> preserve <WH5341> <WH8799> the king <WH4428>: and his throne <WH3678> is upholden <WH5582> <WH8804> by mercy <WH2617>.
The glory <WH8597> of young men <WH970> is their strength <WH3581>: and the beauty <WH1926> of old men <WH2205> is the gray head <WH7872>.
The blueness <WH2250> of a wound <WH6482> cleanseht <WH8562> away evil <WH7451>: so do stripes <WH4347> the inward parts <WH2315> of the belly <WH990>.
